name: sema4ai
description: Sema4.ai: Visual Studio Code Extension for AI Actions and Robot Tasks development
author: Sema4.ai, Inc.

sema4ai.language-server.tcp-port.description: If the port is specified, connect to the language server previously started at the given port. Requires a VSCode restart to take effect.

sema4ai.language-server.args.description: Specifies the arguments to be passed to the Sema4.ai language server (i.e.: ["-vv", "--log-file=~/sema4ai_code.log"]). Requires a VSCode restart to take effect.

sema4ai.language-server.python.description: Specifies the path to the python executable to be used for the Sema4.ai Language Server (the default is searching python on the PATH). Requires a VSCode restart to take effect.

sema4ai.rcc.location.description: Specifies the location of the rcc tool.

sema4ai.rcc.endpoint.description: Can be used to specify a different endpoint for rcc.

sema4ai.rcc.config_location.description: Specifies the config location used by rcc.

sema4ai.home.description: Specifies the value for SEMA4AI_HOME (where the conda environments will be downloaded). Must point to a directory without spaces in it.

sema4ai.verifyLSP.description: Verify if the Robot Framework Language Server is installed?

sema4ai.autoSetPythonExtensionInterprete.description: If a file in a Robot is opened, the python extension interpreter is automatically set to match the Robot interpreter.

sema4ai.autoSetPythonExtensionDisableAct.description: Automatically sets the value of "python.terminal.activateEnvironment" to false to avoid wrong auto-activation when Robot terminal is created.

sema4ai.proceedWithLongPathsDisabled.description: Enables Sema4.ai to be started even with long paths disabled.

sema4ai.vaultTokenTimeoutInMinutes.description: Specifies the timeout in minutes for the token generated to access the vault when a launch is made. Note: max 60, min 5, additional timeout may be added internally to reuse the token in future runs (please use Sema4.ai Control Room for longer runs).

sema4ai.codeLens.roboLaunch.description: Specifies whether the 'Run Task' and 'Debug Task' code lenses should be shown.

sema4ai.codeLens.actionsLaunch.description: Specifies whether the 'Run Action' and 'Debug Action' code lenses should be shown.

sema4ai.codeLens.devTask.description: Specifies whether the 'Run Task' and 'Debug Task' code lenses should be shown in `dev-tasks` in `package.yaml`.

robot.description: The robot.yaml file with the task to be launched.

task.description: The task name from the robot to be run.

args.description: Additional command line arguments for running the robot.

env.description: Environment variables to be added to the launch.

configurationSnippets.label: Sema4.ai: Launch task from robot.yaml
configurationSnippets.description: Add a new configuration for launching tasks from a robot.yaml.

commands.title: Create Agent, Action or Task Package
Upload Task Package to Control Room
Set python executable based on robot.yaml
Unlink and remove credentials from Control Room
Upload Task Package to Control Room
Open terminal with Package Python environment
Lists the work items available for a Task Package
Updates the environment variables used for some launch (given a Task Package
Provides the environment variables related to the vault.
Convert output work item to input
Connect to Control Room Workspace (vault, storage, ...)
Sets the currently connected Control Room Workspace
Clear Sema4.ai (RCC) environments and restart Sema4.ai
Show error related to interpreter env creation
Lists the actions available in an action package given a root dir (internal)
Publish Action Package to Sema4.ai Studio
Authenticate the Action Server to Control Room
Authenticate the Action Server to Control Room (internal)
Verify that the action server Control Room credentials are saved (internal)
Upload action package to the Control Room (internal)
Get action package upload status from the Control Room (internal)
Set action package changelog entry in the Control Room (internal)
Publish Action Package to Control Room
Publish Agent Package to Sema4.ai Studio

view/item/context.when: view == sema4ai-package-resources-tree && viewItem == outputWorkItem || viewItem == inputWorkItem

scripts.vscode:prepublish: cd vscode-client && npm run compile && cd ..
